fact_check_explanation_title: Why Rishi Sunak’s wife’s tax status isn’t a direct consequence of her citizenship
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ms Murty uses her non-domiciled status to not pay UK tax on foreign income, but this is an active choice, and not a direct consequence of her Indian citizenship.

fact_check_explanation_title: Keir Starmer wrong to suggest taxes aren’t rising on stocks and shares
fact_check_explanation_summary: While income from stocks and shares isn’t subject to National Insurance, dividend income is subject to dividend tax which is increasing by the same amount.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mirror wrong to say catching Covid in warm weather cuts risk of long Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: Surveys on the prevalence of long Covid did not measure the difference between groups of people based on when they caught Covid in the first place, nor necessarily based on …

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence ‘vast majority’ of people crossing Channel in small boats are economic migrants
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research indicates that the majority of people crossing the Channel go on to be granted asylum, but the full picture is not covered by official statistics.

fact_check_explanation_title: WEF didn’t say that property ownership would become ‘unsustainable’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A screenshot of a tweet claims Klaus Schwab said eating meat and property ownership are unsustainable.

fact_check_explanation_title: 2,612% rise in food bank use under David Cameron needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Trussell Trust did provide about 27 times more food parcels at the end of David Cameron’s time in office than it had at the beginning—but this doesn’t mean food …

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about German Test and Trace costs completely wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The costs of German and UK Covid-19 testing and tracing programmes cannot be easily compared.
Claims that Asda’s non-organic milk is not vegetarian are false and have been circulating since at least 2016.

fact_check_explanation_title: Chris Rock did not say he ‘crossed a line’ following Will Smith Oscars slap
fact_check_explanation_summary: The comedian has not issued an official statement.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence for MP’s claims ‘tens of thousands of people’ have ‘suffered severe damage’ from vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conservative MP Sir Christopher Chope made the claim about Covid-19 vaccines during an interview with GB News.

fact_check_explanation_title: Chris Bryant wrong on 0% EU VAT for heat pumps
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour MP Chris Bryant also claimed that VAT exemption on solar panels already happens in the EU. This isn’t quite true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook video shows actors making a TV series in 2020—not staging the war in Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The clip was first shared by a producer of the series in December 2020.
